private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E
I can perform primitive moves of the form move disk X from pegY to pegZ if legal
agent_1.goal: Contribute legal primitive moves so the multi-agent plan reaches the global goal configuration

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J
I can perform primitive moves of the form move disk X from pegY to pegZ if legal
agent_2.goal: Contribute legal primitive moves so the multi-agent plan reaches the global goal configuration

private_information: I can move only disks K, L, M, N, O
I can perform primitive moves of the form move disk X from pegY to pegZ if legal
agent_3.goal: Contribute legal primitive moves so the multi-agent plan reaches the global goal configuration

private_information: I coordinate the other agents and integrate their move lists into a single verified plan
I will produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards planner
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent move lists, verify global legality under Tower of Hanoi rules, and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that encodes the allowed agent-specific actions and the initial and goal states

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi instance with three pegs named left middle right
There are 15 disks labelled A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Initial configuration left peg top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O middle peg empty right peg empty
Goal configuration left peg top to bottom A E F G H I J K L M N O middle peg top to bottom B right peg top to bottom C D
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk
Each agent may only move the disks explicitly assigned to them

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and you can move only disks A B C D E. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Your moves should be a partial contribution toward achieving the global goal. Do not produce PDDL. Do not assume moves for disks you cannot move. Keep the moves in a single ordered list.

You are agent_2 and you can move only disks F G H I J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Your moves should be a partial contribution toward achieving the global goal. Do not produce PDDL. Do not assume moves for disks you cannot move. Keep the moves in a single ordered list.

You are agent_3 and you can move only disks K L M N O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Your moves should be a partial contribution toward achieving the global goal. Do not produce PDDL. Do not assume moves for disks you cannot move. Keep the moves in a single ordered list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Your task is to integrate the ordered primitive move lists produced by the agents, verify that the combined sequence is globally legal under Tower of Hanoi rules, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names or predicates with the agent identifier. Encode initial and goal configurations exactly as provided in the environment. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should be suitable for FastDownwards and preserve the per-agent action constraints.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the ordered move lists from three agents which are partial contributions to the final plan. Integrate and check those move lists for global legality. If necessary, reorder or insert additional legal moves that respect agent movement permissions and Tower of Hanoi rules, but only include moves for disks moved by the corresponding agent. Produce a PDDL domain and problem that represent the pegs, disks, agent-specific move operators, the initial state, and the goal state. Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. The inputs you will receive are: {moves_agent_1} {moves_agent_2} {moves_agent_3}.
